entry.title: "Manage Business Configuration" tool is not appearing in the search bar
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm currently working in SAP SuccessFactors EC and I've noticed that the "Manage Business Configuration" tool is not appearing in the search bar, even though I can access it through Admin Center > Tools > Manage Business Configuration.

Does anyone know what could be causing this behavior?
I've already checked permissions and can confirm that the tool is accessible — just not searchable.

Any suggestions or insights would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance,

Your help is much appreciated.

Thanks,
Elina

entry.title: Can we create a business rule in the one time payment to automatically update the basic pay
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Can you please help with the business rule to automatically  update the one time pay component with 1 month of basic pay if the one time pay competent is selected . 

Below is the business rule i have created , can you please help what is the issue with this rule as it is not working.

If 

One Time pay component . pay component. Value = XX

then

Set one time pay component amount value =

Amount from pay structure 

Pay scale level = Current user

Pay component = Basic Pay

Effective date = Today

entry.title: Employee Replication Status is 'Sent'
entry.content:
Hi,

While trying to replicate from EC to S/4, I noticed that the Status in Query in S/4 is set to "Sent". I have already asked our CPI team to check. However, they could not find any error from their end.

Has this already happened to any one? If yes, what is the root-cause and solution you have implemented.

Thank you.

entry.content: I am trying to create a take rule to ensure that the leave requested for a period of a time type does not exceed 10 days. but the business requested that this rule should work every year but the rule is only working for this year. and next year the error is not possible. so i had 2 rules to say you cannot book more than ten 10 days at once and the one below but it is only working for this year kindly assist

entry.title: How to schedule integrations after SuccessFactors Employee central data centers move to UTC time zon
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

Considering the fact that all SuccessFactors data centers have moved to the UTC time zone, how can one schedule Cloud platform integrations to correctly pick up records that have become effective on a certain day?

Details - Let's assume my SF EC data center is in Tokyo. And let's also assume that I run my HRIS synch at 1 AM UTC, which is 10 AM JST. The future dated Job information records will become current dated only after the HRIS sync (I could be wrong here). So, in this case, only if I run the integration after 1:15 UTC (10:15 AM JST) will the integration pick up all the records that have become effective on that day. If I run the integration at around 4 AM, the UTC time is still 7 PM the previous day and it won't pick up the records that have become effective on the current day. 

Is there a solution to this? How can I manage to pick up all the records that have become effective on a certain day (along with changes since the last time the integration ran), when I run the integration early in the morning, when it's still the previous day in UTC time zone?

I am currently using Compound Employee SOAP call with last modified on and fromDate/toDate filters. 

Thanks

Kriba

entry.title: Login Methods - PWD, SSO
entry.content:
I am trying to determine how the Login Methods have been assigned to employees within our organisation. 

We appear to have some employees with SSO as their Login Method, some employees with PWD as their Login Method and some employees who appear to have no Login Method at all (which I understand to be the same as SSO).  It's not clear how the Login Method gets populated for an employee in SuccessFactors during the hiring/rehiring process and why some employees appear to have been created with a Login Method of SSO, whilst others have been created with a Login Method of PWD or even no Login Method at all.  How does the system actually determine which Login Method is to be used?  We don't have an Administrator setting the Login Method for individual employees during the hiring process, so the system must be determining the Login Method itself somehow.

Here's what I see in our PRODUCTION system:

  • Those employees who are assigned PWD as their Login Method seem to be either external users OR Onboardees.   We only have 6 countries set up for Onboarding at the moment. 
     
  • Those employees that have no Login Method (Login Method = null) seem to be employees that have been hired from one of the countries that is not using Onboarding.

We asked one employee who has PWD as their Login Method to sign in to SuccessFactors.  Apparently, he was able to do that without receiving any password prompt.   So, even though he has got PWD as the Login Method, he appears to be authenticating via SSO because no password was requested during the sign-on process!   How can this be?

Can anyone please clarify for me how the Login Method gets determined and populated for new employees and rehires.  Am not sure if we have Partial SSO enabled for our organisation but would assume so if we have some employees on SSO and others on PWD?

Regards

Lorna

entry.title: Association from picklist (Employee Class) to Generic Object (Country) feasibility
entry.content:
Hello experts,

Is there a possibility to associate a GO (Country) to a Picklist (Employee Class) and control the selection in the position (MDF Object)?

Eg:
During a creation of position from CANADA and show only the 4 option we have available to this country for employee class.

CANADA -> Options availlable: A, F, H and J

 

I don't want to change the system and transform cust_country to picklist.... but I think is the unique way....

During a creation of position from UNITED STATES and show only the 4 option we have available to this country for employee class.

CANADA -> Options availlable: B, D, X and Z

entry.title: Custom Task for new Hire to Complete on day 1
entry.content:
Hello,

We would like to set up custom new hire tasks for employees to complete on their first day of employment.  The tasks should appear on the employee's homepage one by one, a new one appearing after the employee has completed the previous task. Does anyone have any experience something like this?

I use my Macbook, and If I download the templates for Foundation Object or Employee Import, then open them in Excel, the file seems to be read incorrectly, showing every type of data in a single cell (see the screenshot attached to this message). Could you kindly advise on how to adjust the system or the app for it to be viewed correctly?

Kind regards,
A.

entry.title: In Reward and Recognition I would like to remove the 'Redeemed Awards' from Awards History
entry.content:
I've used this KBA 3397410 - Redemption Tile Permission - Rewards & Recognition to remove the 'Redeem Rewards' tile from the reward and recognition page, as we do not have any redeemable rewards configured. However, when someone views their Awards History, and clicks the dropdown there are still options to select 'All Redeemed' or 'All Refunded' under the 'Redeemed Rewards' header (see attached screenshot). I would like to remove those options from the dropdown so that only 'Received' and 'Sent' remain under the Spot Awards header. Is this possible?

Thanks,

Lily

entry.content: Hello, is there a way to export all job profiles out of job profile content in SAP SucessFactors Employee Central. We use Job Profile Builder

entry.title: location and country/region columns missing on the UDF
entry.content:
Hello experts,

The location and country/region columns are missing on the exported udf even if it's enabled on manage business configuration, and it's listed on sysVisibleUserDirectorySetting as you can see below. Any suggestion please?

entry.title: Employee Central Alerts: Limitation
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Since SAP SuccessFactors introduced specific rule scenarios for configuring Business Rules, we now have the option to use the "Generate Employee Central Alerts" scenario to trigger alerts in EC.

However, I've encountered a limitation: it is not possible to use personal base objects —specifically, Dependent or Employee Information —within this rule scenario. This restriction prevents us from setting up alerts based on conditions such as "employee turns 65" or "dependent reaches 18 years old."

Has anyone found a workaround for this limitation? 

Thanks in advance for any suggestions!

Where can I post my questions regarding the live work scenarios? These are questions that need an experienced person to answer in terms of real life situations. 

Below are the areas I am looking to ask my questions:

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting, SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, SAP SuccessFactors People Analytics Reporting

Thanks in advance, Arul

entry.title: importing employees using optionId
entry.content:
Hello experts,

Is it mandatory to put the optionId instead of the picklist value while importing employees? In my case, when I put the picklist value on the column country, it's empty on the employee profile, but for the location column, it works with the picklist value, both of the fields are associated with a picklist. 

My client does not have Employee Central

entry.title: "My Learning Journey with SAP SuccessFactors: From Beginner to Confident User"
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I recently completed my learning of the SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central and I wanted to share my experience and progress with others who are also starting their journey.

I’ve explored key features like #managing employee data, #organizational structure, #job information, and #workflow. One of the most interesting parts for me was understanding how #Foundation Objects and #MDF object work together to support the core HR processes.

I also learned how important #event reasons, #workflows, and #business rules are when configuring employee lifecycle actions like hiring, promotions, and terminations.

Overall, it has been a great learning experience, and I’m excited to continue learning other modules like #Recruiting and Learning.

If anyone has tips or resources for #hands-on practice or #preparing for certification, I’d love to hear your suggestion

Thank you to the SAP Community for all the helpful blogs and answers!

entry.title: What's the best way to practice SAP SuccessFactors if I’m just starting out?
entry.content: Please share how you started practicing  SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central as a beginner tips are welcome!
